pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.10: See [pli-tv-bu-vb-ss13:2.16]() for the meaning of _suṇanti_ in this context.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.1.53: The Pali just says _dukkaṭa_, without specifying that it is an _āpatti_, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at [pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:2.65](), the _dukkaṭa_ is annulled if you commit the full offense of _saṅghādisesa_. The implication is that in these contexts _dukkaṭa_ should be read as _āpatti dukkaṭassa_, “an offense of wrong conduct”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc68:2.3.5: By editorial mistake the Pali is missing _ādikammikassa_, “the first offender”. This is a universal exception that applies to all the rules of the Vinaya.
